final_answer.precision_note: Three significant figures. Input mole values (0.180 mol, 0.220 mol) have 3 sig figs. Volume (2.00 dm3) has 3 sig figs. Kc values expressed as dimensionless ratio per instructions.

method: Calculate concentrations from equilibrium moles: [NO2] = moles / volume, [N2O4] = moles / volume where V = 2.00 dm3. [NO2] = 0.180 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.0900 mol dm-3. [N2O4] = 0.220 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.110 mol dm-3. Apply equilibrium constant expression: Kc = [NO2]^2 / [N2O4] for reaction N2O4(g) <-> 2NO2(g) from line 20. Kc = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110. Calculate numerator: (0.0900)^2 = 0.00810. Calculate Kc: 0.00810 / 0.110 = 0.0736. Alternative path using moles directly: Kc = (n(NO2)/V)^2 / (n(N2O4)/V) = (n(NO2))^2 / ((n(N2O4)) × V) = (0.180)^2 / (0.220 × 2.00) = 0.0324 / 0.440 = 0.0736. Verify calculation: 0.0324 / 0.44 = 0.0736. Result dimensionless as per line 21 instruction.
checks: Concentration NO2: 0.180/2.00 = 0.0900 mol dm-3, concentration calculation verified
Concentration N2O4: 0.220/2.00 = 0.110 mol dm-3, concentration calculation verified
